actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5. The next meeting is scheduled for 11:00 a.m. on February 24, 2023.

actions-list.header: Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 3003, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe: Mr. Aderholt, Mr. Hudson, Mrs. Spartz and Mr. Lawler.

actions-list.header: Congressional-Executive Commission on the People's Republic of China
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C 6913, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Congressional-Executive Commission on the People's Republic of China: Mr. Mast, Mrs. Steel, Mr. Zinke and Mr. Nunn of Iowa.

Pursuant to section 4(c) of H. Res. 5, 118th Congress, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to co-chair the Tom Lantos Human Rights Commission: Mr. Smith of New Jersey.

Pursuant to 2 U.S.C. 501(b), as amended by Public Law 116-260, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the House Communications Standards: Mr. Carey, Mr. Latta and Mrs. Cammack.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Reverend William Gurnee, St. Joseph's Catholic Church, Washington, DC.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Christopher H. Smith to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
